guidesSubtitle: Learn how to make the most out of MegaMail with these step-by-step guides for essential features.
askAnythingPlaceholder: Ask anything about email marketing, campaigns, deliverability...
guideAIAssistantTitle: How to Use the AI Assistant
guideAIAssistantStep1Desc:
The AI Assistant is a general-purpose chatbot that can help you with a wide range of topics related to email marketing and using the MegaMail app. Here are some examples of what you can ask:
  • How do I improve my email open rates?
  • What is the difference between a List and a Segment?
  • Can you give me 5 subject line ideas for a summer sale?
  • Explain what DMARC is in simple terms.
  • How can I add a new contact to a list?
  • What are some best practices for email design?
  • Help me write a short welcome email for new subscribers.
Feel free to ask anything you're curious about!
guideAccountStep1Desc: Navigate to Account from the sidebar footer. In the General tab, you can change your display theme and language. In the Profile tab, you can update your personal and company information.
guideAccountStep2Desc: Within the Account view, select the Security tab. Here, you can change your login password to keep your account secure.
guideAccountStep3Desc: Advanced sending settings are managed under the main Settings view, accessible from the sidebar footer. This is where you will manage your Domains, SMTP credentials, API Keys, and subscription Forms.
guideAccountStep4Desc: Your purchase history can be found in the Orders tab within the Account view. You can also view and unlock new features in the Modules tab.
guideDomainStep1Desc: From the main sidebar, click on Settings. In the settings view, select the Domains tab.
guideDomainStep2Desc: Enter your sending domain (e.g., yourwebsite.com) in the input field at the top of the page and click Add Domain. Do not include www or https://.
guideDomainStep3Desc: Log in to your domain provider (like GoDaddy, Cloudflare, etc.) and add the SPF, DKIM, Tracking, and DMARC records as shown in the verification panel. These are essential for email deliverability.
guideDomainStep4Desc: Once the DNS records are added, return to the Domains tab and click the Check DNS Status button. It may take some time for DNS changes to propagate. Once all records are verified, you are ready to send!
guideImportStep1Desc: Ensure your contact list is saved as a CSV file. The first row should contain headers like Email, FirstName, and LastName.
guideImportStep2Desc: Navigate to the Contacts view from the sidebar. Click the Import Contacts button to open the import wizard. Upload your CSV file and confirm that your contacts have given you permission to email them.
guideImportStep3Desc: On the next screen, match the columns from your CSV file to the contact fields in MegaMail (e.g., match your 'Email' column to the 'Email' field). Click Import to finish.
guideCampaignStep1Desc: Go to Templates to design a new email or go to the Gallery to choose a pre-made design. You can also start a campaign from scratch by clicking Marketing in the sidebar.
guideCampaignStep2Desc: In the Marketing Wizard, you will be prompted to select who should receive your email. You can choose to send to all contacts, one or more Lists, or a dynamic Segment.
guideCampaignStep3Desc: Finally, fill in your campaign settings like the name and tracking options. Review the summary and choose to Send Now or Schedule for a later time.
guideTemplateStep1Desc: Navigate to Email Builder from the sidebar to open the drag-and-drop editor.
guideTemplateStep2Desc: Drag components like headers, text, and images from the left toolbar onto the canvas. Click on any block to open the settings panel on the right and customize its style and content.
guideTemplateStep3Desc: Once you are happy with your design, enter a unique name for your template in the header and click the Save Template button. It will now be available in the Templates view for future campaigns.
guideMarketingCampaignStep1Desc: From the sidebar, click on Marketing. This will launch a step-by-step wizard to guide you through the process.
guideMarketingCampaignStep2Desc: Choose who will receive this campaign. You can send to All Contacts, specific Lists, or dynamic Segments.
guideMarketingCampaignStep3Desc: Select a pre-made template you created earlier. Fill in your sender name and a compelling subject line.
guideMarketingCampaignStep4Desc: On the final step, review all your campaign details. You can choose to Send Now, Schedule it for a specific time, or Save as Draft to work on it later.
guideStatisticsStep1Desc: Click on Statistics in the sidebar for an overview of your account's performance over time. You can filter by date range.
guideStatisticsStep2Desc: For detailed reports on individual campaigns, navigate to the Campaigns view.
guideStatisticsStep3Desc: Click on any sent campaign from the list. This will open a detailed report showing open rates, click rates, bounces, unsubscribes, and more.
guideListsSegmentsStep1Desc: Go to the Audience section in the sidebar. You will see two main options: Email Lists and Segments.
guideListsSegmentsStep2Desc: Click on Email Lists. Here you can create a new list, rename existing ones, or click on a list to view and manage the contacts within it. Lists are static; you manually add or remove contacts.
guideListsSegmentsStep3Desc: Click on Segments. Segments are dynamic lists based on rules (e.g., all contacts who opened an email in the last 30 days). Click Create Segment, give it a name, and build your rules. Contacts will automatically be added or removed from the segment as they match or unmatch your rules.
guideCreditsStep1Desc: Navigate to the Buy Credits view from the sidebar footer. Use the slider to select a credit package and click Order. You will be taken to a confirmation page to choose your payment method (Online Payment or Bank Transfer).
guideCreditsStep2Desc: Credits are automatically deducted from your balance when you send an email campaign. The number of credits used is equal to the number of recipients. You can always see your current balance on the Dashboard or in the Buy Credits view.
guideCreditsStep3Desc: Some advanced features are available as purchasable modules. You can find them in Account > Modules. Click Unlock on any module and confirm the purchase to spend your credits and gain instant access to the new feature.
guideOrdersTitle: How to View & Manage Your Orders
guideOrdersStep1Desc: Go to Account in the sidebar and then select the Orders tab. Here you will see a history of all your credit and module purchases.
guideOrdersStep2Desc: If an order has a Pending status, it means you started the purchase process but did not complete the payment. Click the View icon, then click Continue Order to return to the payment selection screen.
guideOrdersStep3Desc: A Processing status means you selected 'Bank Transfer' but have not yet provided your payment details. Click the View icon, then click Submit Bank Info to go to the form where you can enter your transaction details for our team to review.
guideOrdersStep4Desc: For any Completed order, you can view a detailed invoice. Click the View icon, and then click View Invoice to see a printable invoice for your records.
